abstract.p: Letter from Brian T Hess says those who object to video game called Panty Raider: From Here to Immaturity (May 18 article) should realize that censorship will not work, but marketplace will, to discourage such games

block.p: I would suggest to the groups that are protesting and attempting to halt the distribution of the video game called ''Panty Raider: From Here to Immaturity'' that they look around at the game's neighbors (''Game Draws a Range of Protests,'' May 18).

I would suggest to the groups that are protesting and attempting to halt the distribution of the video game called ''Panty Raider: From Here to Immaturity'' that they look around at the game's neighbors (''Game Draws a Range of Protests,'' May 18).

This is a landscape overpopulated with steroid- and silicone-pumped thugs and thugettes, armed to the pecs with high-powered weaponry. Groups wishing to stand against the deluge of entertainment that is mean-spirited, filled with pointless aggression or just in bad taste should realize that censorship is not the answer.
People's attitudes will control the depth of this rising tide. If these types of games do not sell, others like them, or even worse, will not be created.
